motions.title: Resolution Appointing Dunwoody Municipal Court Judges
motions.description: Resolution appointing Hugh R. Powell Chief Judge and Michael M. Hawkins, Melissa Scheidel, Tonya Shy, Kenneth Wickham, and Timothy W. Wolfe Associate Judges of Dunwoody Municipal Court.

motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval as Amended
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda as amended (items 20 and 21 moved to business items) including: • May 23, 2022 City Council meeting minutes • Resolution appointing members to serve on the Alcohol License Review Board • Resolution appointing members to serve on the Board of Ethics • Resolution appointing members to serve on the Urban Redevelopment Agency • SECOND READ: Street name change, Goldkist Road to Campus Way • SECOND READ: Amendment to the Public Art Ordinance • SECOND READ: Text amendment to outdoor lighting regulations • Approval of increase in insurance liability coverage through Georgia Interlocal Risk Management Agency • Georgetown Gateway project enhancements • Contract to upgrade stormwater pipe crossing near 3900 Spalding Drive • Request for approval of standby stormwater repair unit price contract • Approval of Flock Group additional services agreement to lease additional LPRs

motions.title: Spruill Arts Center and Dunwoody Nature Center Match Funding
motions.description: Approval of Spruill Arts Center and Dunwoody Nature Center match funding with each entity having raised $1M capital and city matching funds.

motions.title: Amendment to American Rescue Plan (ARP) Budget
motions.description: Approval of amendment to the American Rescue Plan (ARP) budget.

motions.title: Park at Perimeter Center East Construction Update and Storm Water Repair Change Order
motions.description: Approval of storm water repair change order for Park at Perimeter Center East construction project.

motions.title: Text Amendment to the Definition of Entertainment Districts (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendment to the definition of Entertainment Districts.

motions.title: Text Amendment to the Perimeter Center Overlay Regulations (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendment to the Perimeter Center Overlay Regulations.

motions.title: Motion to Table Tree Preservation Regulations Text Amendment
motions.description: Motion to table text amendment to the Tree Preservation Regulations (second read).

motions.title: Approval of Janitorial Contract for City Facilities
motions.description: Approval of janitorial contract with CEGLR Group for city facilities, subject to final legal review.

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for the purpose of litigation and real estate discussion.

specialEvents.title: Administration of Oath of Office - Municipal Court Judges
specialEvents.description: Mayor Deutsch administered the oath of office to Associate Judges Michael M. Hawkins, Melissa Scheidel, Tonya Shy, and Timothy Wolfe.

presentations.title: Future of Work Snapshot
presentations.description: Presentation showing hybrid work schedules appear to be most common moving forward.

discussionItems.title: Proposed Enhancements to the Reconstructed Chamblee Dunwoody Bridge over I-285
discussionItems.description: Refined concept for enhancements to the reconstructed Chamblee Dunwoody bridge over I-285. Council consensus that branding Dunwoody on the bridge was very important.

discussionItems.title: Tilly Mill Road Path between Mount Vernon Road to Womack Road Concept Design
discussionItems.description: Two alternatives for conceptual design presented. Staff recommends East side alternative. Council Member Harris recused herself due to working for Marcus Jewish Community Center.

discussionItems.title: Lease Agreement with Georgia Power for Streetlights on Chamblee Dunwoody Road
discussionItems.description: Lease agreement with installation cost of $523,000 and monthly cost of $1,800.

discussionItems.title: Request for Approval of On-Call Stormwater Engineering and Design Contract
discussionItems.description: Four firms selected: Tetra Tech, Dewberry Engineers, Freese and Nicols, and Pond & Company.

discussionItems.title: Millage Rate Update
discussionItems.description: Three public hearings scheduled: June 17 at 8:00 a.m., July 11 at 8:00 a.m., and July 11 at 6:00 p.m. Proposed millage rate advertised at 3.040 mills from 2.740 mills.

discussionItems.title: Discussion of Feedback from Town Hall Meetings
discussionItems.description: Feedback from Town Hall meetings presented with capital list based on public input. Discussion on potential bond issuance with bond counsel present.
